Posted By: achilleselbow (8/8/2010 4:57:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The thing to remember about cards that do damage to a creature is, for 2 mana, you can usually just destroy a creature outright. OK, that usually requires black, and off-color effects are more expensive, but it's still awfully hard to justify more than 3 mana for something that does nothing but damaging creatures. At 4 mana and an extra card? That's just absurd.
posts.html:
The thing to remember about cards that do damage to a creature is, for 2 mana, you can usually just destroy a creature outright. OK, that usually requires black, and off-color effects are more expensive, but it's still awfully hard to justify more than 3 mana for something that does nothing but damaging creatures. At 4 mana and an extra card? That's just absurd.

Posted By: holgir (8/5/2009 3:19:58 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I happen to like this card, the friends I play casually with have come to fear this card, since I play it in my hellbent/madness deck. It really puts pressure on my opponents (when we discard "randomly" we just put our hand face down and have an opponent pick one) because the card they pick could easily be [Call to the Netherworld](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Netherworld), or [Dark Withering](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Withering), or [Big Game Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Big Game Hunter), or at the least it could be a [Reckless Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reckless Wurm). I like to screw with my friends' heads by using cards like this. But I admit it's limited to what type of deck it can be played in and actually be good. I give it 2.5/5  
  
Also, I realize [Lightning Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Axe) is a much better version of this card but I just get a kind of nostalgic feeling from using older cards like this. That being said, I only run one of these in my deck, with a play set of lightning axes
posts.html:
I happen to like this card, the friends I play casually with have come to fear this card, since I play it in my hellbent/madness deck. It really puts pressure on my opponents (when we discard "randomly" we just put our hand face down and have an opponent pick one) because the card they pick could easily be Call to the Netherworld, or Dark Withering, or Big Game Hunter, or at the least it could be a Reckless Wurm. I like to screw with my friends' heads by using cards like this. But I admit it's limited to what type of deck it can be played in and actually be good. I give it 2.5/5

Also, I realize Lightning Axe is a much better version of this card but I just get a kind of nostalgic feeling from using older cards like this. That being said, I only run one of these in my deck, with a play set of lightning axes
